Authors: Syahputra M.E., Hutabarat D.P., Budijono S., Lukas J.
Title: Eco Friendly Emergency Alert System (EFEAS) based on microcontroller and android application
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Syahputra, M.E., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hutabarat, D.P., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lukas, J., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Eco Friendly Emergency Alert System (EFEAS) is a home security system that aims to help residents to get emergency response assistance when a threat enters their home. EFEAS is developed using a microcontroller, android application and solar panel devices. Microcontroller is used to develop a main device of EFEAS that functions to activate siren, send SMS, switch electrical power from solar panels to conventional source or vice versa, and communicate with an android smartphone. Android application is developed and used to connect the android smartphone to the system. This system will activate sirene, send alerts and the location of the house when the panic button pushed by the user. With the implementation of this system residents are expected to be able to get faster handling when there are hazardous conditions in the house. This system developed can achieve the objective of being able to be operated using an Android smartphone to control all components within the system with 100% successful rate to send SMS within 13 seconds and 100% successful rate to switch between solar panel and adaptor. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: Android Application; Arduino Uno; ESP8266; Home security system; Panic button
Index Keywords: Controllers; Environmental protection; Fasteners; Microcontrollers; Security systems; Signaling; Smartphones; Solar cell arrays; Solar concentrators; Android applications; Arduino Uno; ESP8266; Home security systems; Panic button; Android (operating system)

Authors: Susanto R., Oktavianus W., Prayogo W., Budijono S., Wijaya R.
Title: Wearable Device for Restaurant Operational that Employs People with Hearing Impairment
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Susanto, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Oktavianus, W., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prayogo, W., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Speed in serving consumers is one of the top priorities in restaurants. To provide fast and precise service, it needed a device that is able to help the operational system at restaurant. This research focus on creating a device that can help operational system at restaurant that can be controlled using the smartphone. The device is designed to combine several components that were merged into a wearable device. The result is wearable devices that can last 7 hours 34 minutes with 2 hours charging time, average operating distance 35.3 m, and 5% error glitch. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Audition; Charging time; Android; Firebase; Hearing impairments; Operational systems; Research focus; Restaurant; Wearable devices; Wearable technology

Authors: Hutabarat D.P., Budijono S., Saleh R.
Title: Development of home security system using ESP8266 and android smartphone as the monitoring tool
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hutabarat, D.P., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saleh, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: With the increasing number of homes being developed in Jakarta and surrounding area, a home security system is needed to prevent disruption to every home and residents especially when the number of crime increasing. With this system, residents are guaranteed security all the time either when residents are at home or outside the home. This paper demonstrates the implementation of home security system for homes using low cost and low power consumption wireless security systems. In this eco-friendly home security system, devices are installed in every home and will promptly notify residents and local security personnel during interruptions. The owner receives a Short Message Service (SMS) with a link to open the application installed in his/her android smartphone. The security guard also receives SMS with a link to open the map application to show the location of the house using its android smartphone. A 100% success rate of sending SMS and a 100% sensors functionality was proven through the experiment. © 2018 Institute of Physics Publishing. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: android smartphone; GSM module; Home security system; sensors
Index Keywords: Security systems; Sensors; Smartphones; Text messaging; Android smartphone; Gsm modules; Home security systems; Low-power consumption; Monitoring tools; Security personnel; Short message services; Wireless security systems; Android (operating system)

Authors: Hutabarat D.P., Patria D., Budijono S., Saleh R.
Title: Human tracking application in a certain closed area using RFID sensors and IP camera
Source title: Proceedings - 2016 3rd International Conference on Information Technology, Computer, and Electrical Engineering, ICITACEE 2016
Affiliations: Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hutabarat, D.P., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Patria, D., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saleh, R., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Human tracking applications with a Global Positioning System (GPS) can get the user's position in real time on the open area. But if the user goes into the room or building, then the human tracking application cannot get the user's position as the GPS signal cannot get through the wall. By using RFID, human tracking application can perform tracking in a certain closed area by providing room's or building's information that is entered. The IP camera as part of the system will send the images as visualization inside the room. In this research, human tracking system is built on a specific area that has lots of room or building such as a theme park or sports club. System is designed using an RFID reader, RFID tags, IP Camera, the database server and Android smartphones. The research was done inside Syahdan Campus, Bina Nusantara University - Jakarta. The result shows that the application is working with 100% tapping and mapping accuracy. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Android; closed area; IP Camera; RFID; smart phone

Authors: Hutabarat D.P., Hendry H., Pranoto J.A., Kurniawan A., Budijono S., Saleh R., Hedwig R.
Title: Human tracking in certain indoor and outdoor area by combining the use of RFID and GPS
Source title: APWiMob 2016 - IEEE Asia Pacific Conference on Wireless and Mobile 2016, Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hutabarat, D.P., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hendry, H., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pranoto, J.A., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kurniawan, A., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saleh, R., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: A similar research experiment on the use of global positioning system (GPS) had successfully been published in 2014 [1]. In this paper, the research was continued by combining radio-frequency identification (RFID) and GPS in order to get better human tracking in both indoor and outdoor area. For indoor tracking, an RFID tag was carried by a user and continually read whenever he/she accessed a room while GPS was used mainly when the user was staying outdoor. GPS would be automatically activated whenever the user leaved the room 3 meters away. The accuracy of this tracking was 100% and the GPS could allocate the user every 3.27 meters. Thus this application is suitable to track the human position for both indoor and outdoor. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: ADB; GPS; human tracking; raspberry pi; RFID

Title: Impact of information communication technology in implementation of integrated marketing communication at fast food outlet
Affiliations: Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Information System, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Budijono, S., Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nelly, School of Information System, Binus University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information and Communication Technology in 21st century is an ancillary tool for several aspects in business area. Most company of fast food industry in developing countries regards this kind of Technology as a cost and tries to reduce their use. In fast food industry, marketing is one of the important parts to propagate information products sold by the company; this information must be able to reach these consumers and the corresponding target desired by the company. Integrated Marketing Communication can be use for fast food industry to increase brand awareness, customer satisfaction, greater profitability, and increase the sale. This paper discusses how to use Information and Communication Technology with limited cost as a tools for company in fast food industry to ancillary their Integrated Marketing Communication process to increase sales and profit. The methodology used by this paper are using literature for gather preliminary information and using limited data from fast food company that runs limited Integrated Marketing Communication process. The result of this limited study is company can run Integrated Marketing Program using limited cost in Information and Communication Technology, and Fast Food Company can differentiate marketing program within company outlets. Using web analysis, this paper can be use for deeper research in implementation Low Cost Information and Communication Technology in fast food industry, especially as an ancillary tools for run more accurately Integrated Marketing Communication program within outlets in company. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.

Authors: Budijono S., Andrianto J., Axis Novradin Noor M.
Title: Design and implementation of modular home security system with short messaging system
Affiliations: Subject Content Specialist, Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Bachelor Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Budijono, S., Subject Content Specialist, Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Andrianto, J., Bachelor Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Axis Novradin Noor, M., Bachelor Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Today we are living in 21st century where crime become increasing and everyone wants to secure they asset at their home. In that situation user must have system with advance technology so person do not worry when getting away from his home. It is therefore the purpose of this design to provide home security device, which send fast information to user GSM (Global System for Mobile) mobile device using SMS (Short Messaging System) and also activate - deactivate system by SMS. The Modular design of this Home Security System make expandable their capability by add more sensors on that system. Hardware of this system has been designed using microcontroller AT Mega 328, PIR (Passive Infra Red) motion sensor as the primary sensor for motion detection, camera for capturing images, GSM module for sending and receiving SMS and buzzer for alarm. For software this system using Arduino IDE for Arduino and Putty for testing connection programming in GSM module. This Home Security System can monitor home area that surrounding by PIR sensor and sending SMS, save images capture by camera, and make people panic by turn on the buzzer when trespassing surrounding area that detected by PIR sensor. The Modular Home Security System has been tested and succeed detect human movement. © Owned by the authors, published by EDP Sciences, 2014.
References: Azid, S.I., Kumar, S., Analysis and performance of a low cost SMS based home security system (2011) International Journal of Smart Home, 5 (3); Khan, S.R., Al Mansur, A., Kabir, A., Jaman, S., Chowdhury, N., Design and implementation of low cost home security system using GSm network (2012) International Journal of Scientific and Engineering Research, 3 (3); Valouch, J., Integration of alarm systems (2012) International Journal of Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity, 3; Azid, S.I., Sharma, B., Intelligent home: SMS based home security system with immediate feedback (2012) World Academy of Science, Engineering and Technology, 72; Mahendran, N., Joe Mathai, G., Veenesh, M.U., Multiple sensor feeding supported building automation system using arduino platform with exposure of 802.15.4 functionalities (2013) International Journal of Engineering Trends and Technology, 4 (2); http://arduino.cc/en/Main/arduinoBoardUno, Arduino Uno website; http://www.simcom.eu/index.php?m=letoltes, Simcom GSM modem website; http://www.seeedstudio.com/wiki/File:Twig_-_BISS0001.pdf, Seedstudio PIR sensor website; http://www.dfrobot.com/wiki/index.php/Digital_Buzzer_Module_(SKU :_DFR0032), DFRobot Buzzer Alarm website; http://www.dfrobot.com/wiki/index.php/Real_Time_Clock_Module_(DS1307 )_(SKU:DFR0151), DFRobot Realtime clock website; http://seeedstudio.com/wiki/Grove_-_Serial_Camera, Twig Serial Camera website; http://www.dfrobot.com/wiki/index.php/ MicroSD_card_module_for_Arduino_%28SKU:DFR0229%29, MicroSD Adapter for Arduino website
